Others: The Detroit Pistons secured their first winning streak of the season by defeating the Los Angeles Lakers with a score of 115-103.
Jaden Ivey led the Pistons with 26 points, and six players finished the game in double figures.
Cade Cunningham recorded his first triple-double of the regular season with 17 points, 11 rebounds, and 11 assists.
Anthony Davis led the Lakers with 37 points, and LeBron James finished with 20 points and 11 assists.
Bench scoring was a key factor in the matchup, with the Lakers producing only 10 points from their second unit, while the Pistons got 27 points from their bench.
The Pistons have an off day on Tuesday before resuming action on Wednesday against the Charlotte Hornets.
